columns.name: source_server_id
columns.description: The id of the source server.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source server

columns.name: recovery_instance_id
columns.description: The ID of the Recovery Instance associated with this Source Server.

columns.name: source_properties
columns.description: The source properties of the Source Server.

columns.name: data_replication_info
columns.description: The Data Replication Info of the Source Server.

columns.name: last_launch_result
columns.description: The status of the last recovery launch of this Source Server.

columns.name: life_cycle
columns.description: The lifecycle information of this Source Server.

columns.name: replication_direction
columns.description: Replication direction of the Source Server.

columns.name: reversed_direction_source_server_arn
columns.description: For EC2-originated Source Servers which have been failed over and then failed back, this value will mean the ARN of the Source Server on the opposite replication direction.

columns.name: source_cloud_properties
columns.description: Source cloud properties of the Source Server.

columns.name: staging_area
columns.description: The staging area of the source server.

columns.name: staging_account_id
columns.description: The staging account ID that extended source servers belong to.

columns.name: launch_configuration
columns.description: The launch configuration settings of the source server.

columns.name: hardware_id
columns.description: An ID that describes the hardware of the Source Server. This is either an EC2 instance id, a VMware uuid or a mac address.
